alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 3:31PM MDT until June 15 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River near Kinnear affecting Fremont County. Wind River at Riverton affecting Fremont County. Wind River near Crowheart affecting Fremont County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Wind River Basin...including Dubois, Crowheart, Kinnear, Riverton...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Wind River near Crowheart. * WHEN...Until Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Bankfull stage. At 9.5 feet, Very minor low land flooding begins. At 10.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor low land flooding becomes more widespread. Access road to gage begins to be covered with water. At 10.5 feet, Moderate low land flooding upstream and downstream of gage. Access to gage is becomes limited. At 10.9 feet, Record flow---14,700 cfs (7/1/2011). At 11.0 feet, Major low land and agricultural flooding upstream and downstream. High water begins to impact Highway 26 northwest of Morton to the Highway 26 Bridge. Access to gage is severely limited. At 11.2 feet, Record stage (6/19/1999). * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM MDT Monday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM MDT Monday was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 10.7 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.2 feet on 06/14/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. This warning will be in effect until the river falls below its flood stage. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM MDT.
